revised_title: Researches into the Electrogenic Condition of Muscular Nerves
tldr: Marshall Hall investigates the effects of electric currents on the nervous system, specifically focusing on the electrogenic condition of muscular nerves. He describes experiments using a frog's isolated nerves and muscles, observing spasmodic contractions and tetanoid rigidity after discontinuing the voltaic current. Hall concludes that the phenomena involve a yet-to-be fully investigated voltaic principle.
